page.title: 17ST.MATTHEW'S HOSPITAL.1.
page.content: Lisa Talbot. The Buildings and Grounds. The approach to the hospital is a long tarmac drive lined with trees of many different types,Lime,Oak,Horse Chestnut and Pine.The driveway is very majestic with a gatehouse at the entrance and long strips of grass along each side of it. Then you see lots of old fashioned buildings.There is then a very large building.You can tell that it is Victorian by the windows which are Dome shaped with a row of cream,blue and red coloured bricks over the top.The hospital was built originally in 1864. Over the entrance is a clock tower.There is a square block at the top with a clock face on each side. The hospital stands in its own grounds of 60 acres and also owns a farm.
